modules.description: Returns vertical metrics from font data, including baseline offset, text descent, and spacing between lines. Operates on font-specific vertical dimension structures derived from TrueType data. Used to calculate text layout and spacing in rendering pipelines.

Calculates the horizontal advance width of a glyph and retrieves its left side bearing from TrueType font metrics. It operates on the `Stb_truetype.hmetrics` type, which represents glyph-specific horizontal measurements. Used to position text accurately in rendering pipelines.

Extracts the minimum and maximum x and y coordinates from a bounding box structure. Constructs a new bounding box from four integer parameters representing x and y coordinates. Used to represent and manipulate glyph hit boxes in font rendering operations.

Creates and manipulates contiguous memory buffers using Bigarray arrays, supporting byte-level access and slicing. Provides operations to retrieve, update, and inspect elements within the buffer structure. Used for efficient handling of raw binary data in graphics or file processing tasks.

Provides functions for rendering 2D vector graphics, including drawing shapes, text, and images with support for transformations and color blending. Works with primitives like paths, fonts, and textures, and manages rendering contexts. Used to create interactive visual interfaces and data-driven graphics in web and desktop applications.

Extracts and manipulates font metrics, including vertical positioning, glyph spacing, and bounding box dimensions, from TrueType data. Handles horizontal advance widths and side bearings using `Stb_truetype.hmetrics`, and constructs bounding boxes from coordinate ranges. Manages raw binary data through Bigarray buffers for efficient memory access and modification. Enables precise text layout, glyph positioning, and efficient data processing in rendering and file operations.
